content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function in Julia that should do what you're asking for:
```
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
 code_blocks = String[]
 parser = Markdown.Parser(md)
 while !Markdown.is_eof(parser)
 block = Markdown.parse_block(parser)
 if block isa Markdown.CodeBlock
 code = String(block.text)
 push!(code_blocks, code)
 end
 end
 return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
This function uses the `Markdown` package in Julia to parse the markdown document and extract all the code blocks. It then removes any code fences (the three backticks at the beginning and end of each code block) and joins all the code blocks together with a newline character. The resulting string of code blocks is then returned.
